title: Strictly Come Dancing week 2: the body language - where's the sexual chemistry?
text:
No amount of pancake-tossing could hide the fact that James Cracknell combined the face of a Greek god with the footwork of Flipper in the weekend's two installments. Despite some hefty competition from David James, whose body language signals of un-masked embarrassment on week one were contagious, it was Cracknell out first last night. It was quite clear that neither of those two celeb dancers were particularly enjoying themselves, but what could be read into how everyone else was feeling about the dancing and - most importantly - each other?

How are the judges getting on?

Bruno Tonioli’s odd, head-nuzzling assault on Shirley Ballas’s chest after he was apparently roused into a state of mock...
description: No amount of pancake-tossing could hide the fact that James Cracknell combined the face of a Greek god with the footwork of Flipper in the weekend's two installments.
